STM 0.0.0.9000

  • Changelog

Max-Reps Tables

max_reps_tables.Rd

Family of functions to represent max reps tables

get_max_reps_relInt(perc_1RM, adjustment = 1, type = "grinding")

get_max_perc_1RM_relInt(max_reps, adjustment = 1, type = "grinding")

get_max_reps_percMR(perc_1RM, adjustment = 1, type = "grinding")

get_max_perc_1RM_percMR(max_reps, adjustment = 1, type = "grinding")

get_predicted_1RM_percMR(weight, reps, adjustment = 1, type = "grinding")

get_max_reps(perc_1RM, adjustment = 0, type = "grinding")

get_max_perc_1RM(max_reps, adjustment = 0, type = "grinding")

get_predicted_1RM(weight, reps, adjustment = 0, type = "grinding")

Arguments

perc_1RM

Percent of 1RM
adjustment

Adjustment to be implemented, specific to the method
type

Type of max rep table. Options are grinding (Default) and ballistic.
max_reps

Maximum repetitions
weight

Weight used
reps

Number of repetitions done

Functions

  • get_max_reps_relInt: Get maximum number of repetitions using the Relative Intensity (adjustment)

  • get_max_perc_1RM_relInt: Get maximum %1RM using the Relative Intensity (adjustment)

  • get_max_reps_percMR: Get maximum number of repetitions using the %MR (adjustment)

  • get_max_perc_1RM_percMR: Get maximum %1RM using the %MR (adjustment)

  • get_predicted_1RM_percMR: Get predicted 1RM using the %MR (adjustment)

  • get_max_reps: Get maximum number of repetitions using the RIR method (adjustment)

  • get_max_perc_1RM: Get maximum %1RM using the RIR method (adjustment)

  • get_predicted_1RM: Get predicted 1RM using the RIR method (adjustment)

Examples

# Get max reps that can be done with 75% 1RM
get_max_reps_relInt(0.75)

#> [1] 10.01

# Get max reps that can be done with 80% 1RM with 60% of Relative Intensity
get_max_reps_relInt(
  perc_1RM = 0.8,
  adjustment = 0.6
)

#> [1] -7.5075

# Get max reps that can be done with 90% 1RM with 60% of Relative Intensity
# using ballistic table
get_max_reps_relInt(
  perc_1RM = 0.9,
  adjustment = 0.6,
  type = "ballistic"
)

#> [1] -5.005
# Get max %1RM to be used when doing 5 reps to failure
get_max_perc_1RM_relInt(5)

#> [1] 0.8572653

# Get max %1RM to be used when doing 3 reps with with 60% of Relative Intensity
get_max_perc_1RM_relInt(
  max_reps = 3,
  adjustment = 0.6,
)

#> [1] 0.5455041

# Get max %1RM to be used when doing 2 reps with 60% of Relative Intensity
# using ballistic table
get_max_perc_1RM_relInt(
  max_reps = 3,
  adjustment = 0.6,
  type = "ballistic"
)

#> [1] 0.5000833
# Get max reps that can be done with 75% 1RM
get_max_reps_percMR(0.75)

#> [1] 10.01

# Get max reps that can be done with 80% 1RM with 60% of maximum reps
get_max_reps_percMR(
  perc_1RM = 0.8,
  adjustment = 0.6
)

#> [1] 4.5045

# Get max reps that can be done with 90% 1RM with 60% of maximum reps
# using ballistic table
get_max_reps_percMR(
  perc_1RM = 0.9,
  adjustment = 0.6,
  type = "ballistic"
)

#> [1] 1.001
# Get max %1RM to be used when doing 5 reps to failure
get_max_perc_1RM_percMR(5)

#> [1] 0.8572653

# Get max %1RM to be used when doing 3 reps with with 60% of maximum reps
get_max_perc_1RM_percMR(
  max_reps = 3,
  adjustment = 0.6,
)

#> [1] 0.8572653

# Get max %1RM to be used when doing 2 reps with 60% of maximum reps
# using ballistic table
get_max_perc_1RM_percMR(
  max_reps = 3,
  adjustment = 0.6,
  type = "ballistic"
)

#> [1] 0.7501875
# Get predicted 1RM when lifting 100kg for 5 reps to failure
get_predicted_1RM_percMR(
  weight = 100,
  reps = 5
)

#> [1] 116.65

# Get predicted 1RM when lifting 120kg for 3 reps with 60% of maximum reps
get_predicted_1RM_percMR(
  weight = 120,
  reps = 3,
  adjustment = 0.6
)

#> [1] 139.98

# Get predicted 1RM when lifting 120kg for 2 reps with 60% of maximum reps
# using ballistic table
get_predicted_1RM_percMR(
  weight = 120,
  reps = 2,
  adjustment = 0.6,
  type = "ballistic"
)

#> [1] 146.64
# Get max reps that can be done with 75% 1RM
get_max_reps(0.75)

#> [1] 10.01

# Get max reps that can be done with 80% 1RM with 2 reps in reserve
get_max_reps(
  perc_1RM = 0.8,
  adjustment = 3
)

#> [1] 4.5075

# Get max reps that can be done with 90% 1RM with 2 reps in reserve
# using ballistic table
get_max_reps(
  perc_1RM = 0.9,
  adjustment = 2,
  type = "ballistic"
)

#> [1] -0.3316667
# Get max %1RM to be used when doing 5 reps to failure
get_max_perc_1RM(5)

#> [1] 0.8572653

# Get max %1RM to be used when doing 3 reps with 2 reps in reserve
get_max_perc_1RM(
  max_reps = 3,
  adjustment = 2
)

#> [1] 0.8572653

# Get max %1RM to be used when doing 2 reps with 3 reps in reserve
# using ballistic table
get_max_perc_1RM(
  max_reps = 3,
  adjustment = 2,
  type = "ballistic"
)

#> [1] 0.7501875
# Get predicted 1RM when lifting 100kg for 5 reps to failure
get_predicted_1RM(
  weight = 100,
  reps = 5
)

#> [1] 116.65

# Get predicted 1RM when lifting 120kg for 3 reps with 2 reps in reserve
get_predicted_1RM(
  weight = 120,
  reps = 3,
  adjustment = 2
)

#> [1] 139.98

# Get predicted 1RM when lifting 120kg for 2 reps with 1 reps in reserve
# using ballistic table
get_predicted_1RM(
  weight = 120,
  reps = 2,
  adjustment = 1,
  type = "ballistic"
)

#> [1] 143.976
